name: Vignar Gray-Mane
location: Whiterun, Gray-Mane estate / Gate area during battle
role: Elder of the Gray-Mane clan; becomes Jarl of Whiterun after Stormcloak victory; leads spearpoint assault in Imperial version of Stage 5

aspects.high_concept: Gray-Mane Patriarch Who Chose Rebellion Over Neutrality
aspects.trouble: My Hatred for the Battle-Borns Clouds My Judgment
other_aspects: Great War Veteran Who Remembers a Better Time
The Old Nord Ways Are Worth Dying For
One Foot in the Grave, Still Standing

stunts: Great War Grit: +2 to Will when resisting attempts to break his resolve or intimidate him.
Elder's Authority: +2 to Command when directing Nord fighters; they will not abandon a position he orders held.
Old Soldier's Last Stand: Once per session, when taken out, Vignar may instead concede with a severe consequence and keep fighting one more exchange.

equipment.special: Gray-Mane family seal (legitimizes Stormcloak claim to Whiterun Jarl seat)

personality_notes.speaking_style: Measured but unflinching. Speaks with the authority of age and hard experience. Does not waste words on people he considers beneath discussion.
motivations: See the Gray-Mane name restored to Whiterun prominence
Free Skyrim from the Empire and Thalmor
Avenge the humiliation of the Gray-Mane/Battle-Born feud
Die as a free Nord, not an Imperial subject
fears: The Battle-Born clan benefiting from his sacrifice
The Gray-Mane line ending with him
Having been wrong about the cause
quirks: Constantly references the Great War to contextualize every argument
Dismisses anyone who didn't fight in the Great War as 'not knowing the cost'
Protective of Olfina Gray-Mane beyond what he'd admit

relationships.Olfina Gray-Mane: Granddaughter; loves her fiercely and disapproves of her relationship with Jon Battle-Born
relationships.Battle-Born Clan: Bitter feudal rivals; despises their Imperial loyalty
relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: The cause he has chosen; absolute support
relationships.Galmar Stone-Fist: Respects as a warrior and tactician
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Views neutrality as cowardice; no personal hatred, just contempt

combat_tactics: Vignar fights as he lived - direct, traditional, and determined. He has no tricks; he relies on will and experience. Takes hits without flinching. Commands those around him naturally.
dragonbreak_precheck: If Vignar is killed during the Imperial Stage 5, trigger a Dragonbreak precheck: Whiterun succession crisis, Companions/Gray-Mane clan fallout, and potential for destabilized post-battle political situation.
scene_triggers: Battle of Whiterun Stage 5 (Imperial side - gatehouse climax)
Whiterun side quests involving Gray-Mane/Battle-Born feud
dialogue_examples: I fought in the Great War. I know what it costs to stand against something that wants to devour you. The Empire is that thing now.
Balgruuf is a good man who made a coward's choice. I don't hate him for it. I pity him.
You want to stop me? Then you'd better be ready to put me down.
This city was Gray-Mane before it was Battle-Born. It will be Gray-Mane after.
gm_notes: Vignar represents the personal human stakes of the civil war's factional conflict. His feud with the Battle-Borns makes the ideological conflict local and immediate. In the Imperial route Stage 5, he is the emotional weight at the gatehouse - not just an enemy commander but an old man who made a choice. His death should carry narrative weight.
